cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
when did muhammad ali win an olympic gold medal
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process:
Muhammad Ali, originally known as Cassius Clay, won an Olympic gold medal in boxing during the 1960 Summer Olympics held in Rome, Italy. He competed in the light heavyweight division and won the gold medal match, which was a significant achievement early in his career. This victory helped to establish him as a prominent athlete and set the stage for his future boxing career.

Answer:
Muhammad Ali won an Olympic gold medal in 1960.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
when did muhammad ali win an olympic gold medal
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
["Shahrudin Mohamed Ali (born 5 May 1941) is a Malaysian sprinter. He competed in the men's 100 metres at the 1960 Summer Olympics.\n", "Muhammad Ali (born 19 June 1933) is a Pakistani boxer. He competed in the men's lightweight event at the 1952 Summer Olympics. At the 1952 Summer Olympics, he lost to Vicente Matute of Venezuela.\n", 'Amal Mahmoud Osman is an Egyptian powerlifter who competes on behalf of her country. She has won medals at three successive Summer Paralympics.\n', 'Bilal Saad Mubarak () (18 December 1972 – 27 October 2018) was a Qatari shot putter. His best finishes include eleventh place at the 1995 World Championships and tenth place at the 1996 Olympic Games. He also has silver medals from the Asian Championships in 1991, 1993 and 2000 and gold medals from 1995, 1998, 2002 and 2003, as well as a silver medal from the 2002 Asian Games.\n', 'One of his first international success came in the Indo-Russian athletic meet in 1978 where he won the 400m gold. In the same year, at the Bangkok Asian Games, Murali won the 400 m bronze behind Abbas Al Aibi of Iraq and compatriot Uday K. Prabhu. With the latter, Murali shared a healthy rivalry through the most part of the 1970s. He was also a member of the silver medal winning Indian team in the 4 × 400 m relay at the 1978 Bangkok Asian Games. In 1981, he won the bronze in the 4 × 400 m relay at the Asian Athletics Championships in Tokyo.\n']

2. **Olympic Achievement**: Ali competed in the light heavyweight division during the 1960 Summer Olympics held in Rome, Italy. He won the gold medal match, which was a pivotal moment in his early career. This victory not only showcased his talent but also helped to elevate his status as a prominent athlete in the boxing world.

3. **Historical Context**: The 1960 Olympics were significant for various reasons, including the backdrop of the civil rights movement in the United States. Muhammad Ali won an Olympic gold medal in boxing in 1960 during the Summer Olympics held in Rome, Italy, competing in the light heavyweight division.

This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content.

Shahrudin Mohamed Ali (born 5 May 1941) is a Malaysian sprinter. He competed in the men's 100 metres at the 1960 Summer Olympics.
Muhammad Ali (born 19 June 1933) is a Pakistani boxer. He competed in the men's lightweight event at the 1952 Summer Olympics. At the 1952 Summer Olympics, he lost to Vicente Matute of Venezuela.
Amal Mahmoud Osman is an Egyptian powerlifter who competes on behalf of her country. She has won medals at three successive Summer Paralympics.
Bilal Saad Mubarak () (18 December 1972 – 27 October 2018) was a Qatari shot putter. His best finishes include eleventh place at the 1995 World Championships and tenth place at the 1996 Olympic Games. He also has silver medals from the Asian Championships in 1991, 1993 and 2000 and gold medals from 1995, 1998, 2002 and 2003, as well as a silver medal from the 2002 Asian Games.
One of his first international success came in the Indo-Russian athletic meet in 1978 where he won the 400m gold. In the same year, at the Bangkok Asian Games, Murali won the 400 m bronze behind Abbas Al Aibi of Iraq and compatriot Uday K. Prabhu. With the latter, Murali shared a healthy rivalry through the most part of the 1970s. He was also a member of the silver medal winning Indian team in the 4 × 400 m relay at the 1978 Bangkok Asian Games. In 1981, he won the bronze in the 4 × 400 m relay at the Asian Athletics Championships in Tokyo.
__answers__: at the 1960 Summer Olympics in Rome
